net.sf.jdivelog.gui.statusbar
Interface StatusInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
StatusBar
public interface StatusInterface

The StatusInterface provides the mechanisms to inform Users about ongoing events.

Author:
Pascal Pellmont

Method Summary
 void commReceive()
          should be called when data is received from a network or comm port.
 void commSend()
          should be called when data is sent through a network or comm port.
 void countingProgressbarEnd()
          stops the progressbar, should be called on completion of a task.
 void countingProgressbarIncrement()
          increments the counter of the progressbar.
 void countingProgressbarStart(int maxCount, boolean showInPercent)
          starts a preogressbar with a defined endpoint
 void infiniteProgressbarEnd()
          stops the progressbar, should be called on completion of a task.
 void infiniteProgressbarStart()
          shows a progressbar which has no defined endpoint, just to signal "there's still runnning something" to the user.
 void messageClear()
          should be called after an operation has been done.
 void messageError(java.lang.String message)
          should be called if the user should be notified about an error which has occured.
 void messageInfo(java.lang.String message)
          can be called on any information what is happening in the system.
 void messageWarn(java.lang.String message)
          should be called on problems occured, but can be handled.
 

Method Detail

commSend

void commSend()
should be called when data is sent through a network or comm port.

commReceive

void commReceive()
should be called when data is received from a network or comm port.

messageError

void messageError(java.lang.String message)
should be called if the user should be notified about an error which has occured.

Parameters:
message - the message to show to the user.

messageWarn

void messageWarn(java.lang.String message)
should be called on problems occured, but can be handled.

Parameters:
message - the message to show to the user.

messageInfo

void messageInfo(java.lang.String message)
can be called on any information what is happening in the system. should be called periodically while progressbar is running.

Parameters:
message - the message to show to the user.

messageClear

void messageClear()
should be called after an operation has been done. clears all status messages.

infiniteProgressbarStart

void infiniteProgressbarStart()
shows a progressbar which has no defined endpoint, just to signal "there's still runnning something" to the user.

infiniteProgressbarEnd

void infiniteProgressbarEnd()
stops the progressbar, should be called on completion of a task.

countingProgressbarStart

void countingProgressbarStart(int maxCount,
                              boolean showInPercent)
starts a preogressbar with a defined endpoint

Parameters:
maxCount - maximum value at end.
showInPercent - true for displaying progress inpercent, false for displaying 1/15, 2/15, ...

countingProgressbarIncrement

void countingProgressbarIncrement()
increments the counter of the progressbar. shows 1/8, 2/8, ... or 10%, 20%, ...

countingProgressbarEnd

void countingProgressbarEnd()
stops the progressbar, should be called on completion of a task.
